Dataframe Report

Source: R/report.data.frame.R
report.data.frame.Rd

Create a report of a dataframe.

# S3 method for data.frame
report(model, median = FALSE, dispersion = TRUE,
  range = TRUE, distribution = TRUE, levels_percentage = FALSE,
  n_characters = 3, missing_percentage = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for character
report(model, n_characters = 3,
  levels_percentage = FALSE, missing_percentage = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for factor
report(model, levels_percentage = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for numeric
report(model, median = FALSE, dispersion = TRUE,
  range = TRUE, distribution = TRUE, missing_percentage = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

model

A data.frame or a vector.
median

Show mean and sd (default) or median and mad.
dispersion

Show dispersion (sd or mad).
range

Show range.
distribution

Returns Kurtosis and Skewness in table.
levels_percentage

Show characters entries and factor levels by number (default) or percentage.
n_characters

Number of different character entries to show. Can be "all".
missing_percentage

Show missings by number (default) or percentage.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

See also

report

report

report

report

Examples

library(report)
x <- iris

report(x)
#> The data contains 150 observations of the following variables:
#>   - Sepal.Length: Mean = 5.84, SD = 0.83, [4.30, 7.90].
#>   - Sepal.Width: Mean = 3.06, SD = 0.44, [2.00, 4.40].
#>   - Petal.Length: Mean = 3.76, SD = 1.77, [1.00, 6.90].
#>   - Petal.Width: Mean = 1.20, SD = 0.76, [0.10, 2.50].
#>   - Species: 3 levels: setosa (n = 50); versicolor (n = 50) and virginica (n = 50).
report(x, median = TRUE, dispersion = TRUE, range = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE)
#> The data contains 150 observations of the following variables:
#>   - Sepal.Length: Median = 5.80, MAD = 1.04, [4.30, 7.90].
#>   - Sepal.Width: Median = 3.00, MAD = 0.44, [2.00, 4.40].
#>   - Petal.Length: Median = 4.35, MAD = 1.85, [1.00, 6.90].
#>   - Petal.Width: Median = 1.30, MAD = 1.04, [0.10, 2.50].
#>   - Species: 3 levels: setosa (n = 50); versicolor (n = 50) and virginica (n = 50).
to_fulltext(report(x))
#> The data contains 150 observations of the following variables:
#>   - Sepal.Length: Mean = 5.84, SD = 0.83, Median = 5.80, MAD = 1.04, Range =, [4.30, 7.90], 0 missing.
#>   - Sepal.Width: Mean = 3.06, SD = 0.44, Median = 3.00, MAD = 0.44, Range =, [2.00, 4.40], 0 missing.
#>   - Petal.Length: Mean = 3.76, SD = 1.77, Median = 4.35, MAD = 1.85, Range =, [1.00, 6.90], 0 missing.
#>   - Petal.Width: Mean = 1.20, SD = 0.76, Median = 1.30, MAD = 1.04, Range =, [0.10, 2.50], 0 missing.
#>   - Species: 3 levels: setosa (n = 50, 33.33%); versicolor (n = 50, 33.33%) and virginica (n = 50, 33.33%).
to_table(report(x))
#> Variable     |      Level |  n_Obs | Mean |   SD |  Min |  Max | n_Missing | Skewness | Kurtosis
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Species      |     setosa |  50.00 |      |      |      |      |           |          |         
#> Species      | versicolor |  50.00 |      |      |      |      |           |          |         
#> Species      |  virginica |  50.00 |      |      |      |      |           |          |         
#> Petal.Length |            | 150.00 | 3.76 | 1.77 | 1.00 | 6.90 |      0.00 |    -0.27 |    -1.40
#> Petal.Width  |            | 150.00 | 1.20 | 0.76 | 0.10 | 2.50 |      0.00 |    -0.10 |    -1.34
#> Sepal.Width  |            | 150.00 | 3.06 | 0.44 | 2.00 | 4.40 |      0.00 |     0.32 |     0.18
to_fulltable(report(x))
#> Variable     |      Level |  n_Obs | Mean |   SD | Median |  MAD |  Min |  Max | n_Missing | Skewness | Kurtosis | percentage_Missing | percentage_Obs
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Species      |     setosa |  50.00 |      |      |        |      |      |      |           |          |          |                    |          33.33
#> Species      | versicolor |  50.00 |      |      |        |      |      |      |           |          |          |                    |          33.33
#> Species      |  virginica |  50.00 |      |      |        |      |      |      |           |          |          |                    |          33.33
#> Petal.Length |            | 150.00 | 3.76 | 1.77 |   4.35 | 1.85 | 1.00 | 6.90 |      0.00 |    -0.27 |    -1.40 |               0.00 |               
#> Petal.Width  |            | 150.00 | 1.20 | 0.76 |   1.30 | 1.04 | 0.10 | 2.50 |      0.00 |    -0.10 |    -1.34 |               0.00 |               
#> Sepal.Width  |            | 150.00 | 3.06 | 0.44 |   3.00 | 0.44 | 2.00 | 4.40 |      0.00 |     0.32 |     0.18 |               0.00 |               
x <- c("A", "B", "C", "A", "B", "B", "D", "E", "B", "D", "A")
report(x)
#> 5 entries: B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2 and 2 others
report(x, n_characters = 2, levels_percentage = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE)
#> 5 entries: B, 0.36%; A, 0.27% and 3 others
to_fulltext(report(x))
#> 5 entries: B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2 and 2 others (0 missing).
to_table(report(x, n_characters = "all"))
#> n_Entries | n_Obs | n_Missing |                                          Entries
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 5.00      | 11.00 |      0.00 | B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2; C, n = 1; E, n = 1
to_fulltable(report(x))
#> n_Entries | n_Obs | n_Missing | percentage_Missing |                      Entries
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 5.00      | 11.00 |      0.00 |               0.00 | B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2
x <- factor(rep(c("A", "B", "C"), 10))
report(x)
#> 3 levels: A (n = 10); B (n = 10) and C (n = 10).
report(x, levels_percentage = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE)
#> 3 levels: A (33.33%); B (33.33%) and C (33.33%).
to_fulltext(report(x))
#> 3 levels: A (n = 10, 33.33%); B (n = 10, 33.33%) and C (n = 10, 33.33%).
to_table(report(x))
#> Level | n_Obs
#> -------------
#> A     | 10.00
#> B     | 10.00
#> C     | 10.00
to_fulltable(report(x))
#> Level | n_Obs | percentage_Obs
#> ------------------------------
#> A     | 10.00 |          33.33
#> B     | 10.00 |          33.33
#> C     | 10.00 |          33.33
# NOT RUN {
x <- rnorm(1000)
report(x)
report(x, median = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE, distribution = TRUE)
to_fulltext(report(x))
to_table(report(x))
to_fulltable(report(x))
# }
